definitions.text: an extra component of a machine or other apparatus
an extra car wheel and tire for a four-wheel vehicle
a score in tenpins; knocking down all ten after rolling two balls
save or relieve from an experience or action
examples: I'll spare you from having to apologize formally

definitions.text: give up what is not strictly needed
examples: he asked if they could spare one of their horses to speed his journey
the spare figure of a marathon runner
a body kept trim by exercise

definitions.text: more than is needed, desired, or required
examples: found some extra change lying on the dresser
yet another book on heraldry might be thought redundant
skills made redundant by technological advance
it was supererogatory of her to gloat
extra ribs as well as other supernumerary internal parts
surplus cheese distributed to the needy

definitions.text: not taken up by scheduled activities
kept in reserve especially for emergency use

examples: functional architecture featuring stark unornamented concrete
